title: SpaceX completes static fire test of its Falcon 9 rocket in preparation for the Polaris Dawn astronaut mission
summary: The ignition test of the nine Merlin engines at the base of the rocket came after the four crew members step through a dry dress rehearsal of their launch day activities. The T-0 for ignition happened at 6:38 a.m. EDT (1038 UTC).

title: Rocket Report: A ULA sale tidbit; Polaris Dawn mission is on deck
summary: "The idea is to learn as much as we possibly can about this suit."

title: Launch Roundup: Polaris Dawn aims high, Starlink launches continue
summary: A total of five flights are on the worldwide launch manifest for this week. Most notable is the launch of a SpaceX Falcon 9 with the Polaris Dawn mission. A modified Crew Dragon capsule will carry four astronauts into the highest orbit a crewed mission has flown in since the Gemini missions.

title: Polaris Dawn astronauts, set to perform first commercial spacewalk, arrive in Florida ahead of launch
summary: The four astronauts, led by businessman Jared Isaacman, will fly onboard SpaceX’s Crew Dragon Resilience. Liftoff is targeting no earlier than Monday, August 26.

title: Polaris Dawn Readies for First Commercial Spacewalk
summary: Jared Isaacman’s Polaris Dawn private astronaut crew arrived at Kennedy Space Center today a week before their scheduled launch. Isaacman and three crewmates will spend about five days aboard a […]

title: Polaris Dawn private astronaut mission ready for launch
summary: A private astronaut mission that will attempt the first commercial spacewalk on a is ready for launch in a week on a SpaceX Crew Dragon.

title: The first SpaceX spacewalk: What the Polaris Dawn commander says about the bold upcoming mission
summary: SpaceX is preparing to launch its next private mission by the end of the month, featuring the first attempt to have the astronauts step out into space.

title: Polaris Dawn Now Targeting NET July 31st For Launch

title: SpaceX reveals its first Extravehicular Activity Suits (EVA) for Polaris Dawn mission

title: Here’s why a rich guy going to space for a second time actually matters
summary: Polaris Dawn will be the first time that SpaceX employees have actually gone to space.
